de.wwu.muggl.vm.loading
Class MugglClassLoader

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.ClassLoader
      de.wwu.muggl.vm.loading.MugglClassLoader

public class MugglClassLoader
extends java.lang.ClassLoader

The MuggleClassLoader replaces the standard java ClassLoader and loads any classes needed within the virtual machine. It also caches.

There are four steps when loading a class:

  1. Try to fetch the class file from the already loaded classes. Loading a class requires file system access, so its always worth searching through the list of loaded classes.
  2. Try to find the class in the projects path. The projects path is stored in the first entry of the class path. Any sub-directories are searched recursively.
  3. Try to find the class in the java environment libraries. For this, all jar-files in the /lib sub-directory of the java-home directory are opened and the desired class searched in them. Sub-directories of /lib are not opened.
  4. Search in the class path entries gradually. Class path entries may be both directories as well as jar-files. If they are directories, the sub-directories of them are also opened recursively.

If the fourth step has been finished without a class being loaded, a ClassNotFoundException is thrown. When executing a project thats class path has been set up correctly and has a appropriate java-home directory specified, this should not happen if the project has been compiled correctly.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-18
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Method Detail

findClass

public java.lang.Class<?> findClass(java.lang.String name)
                             throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Overrides the methods provided by the java ClassLoader. It retrieves a ClassFile, using the method getClassAsClassFile() implemented in this class and takes the bytes read to generate an instance of Class.

Overrides:
findClass in class java.lang.ClassLoader
Parameters:
name - The full name of the desired class, including the package (e.g. java.lang.String).
Returns:
An instance of Class.
Throws:
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when a class could not be found on the application and system class path, or when a ClassFileException or an IOException occurs.

defineClassFromClassFile

public java.lang.Class<?> defineClassFromClassFile(java.lang.String name,
                                                   byte[] b)
Public wrapper for defineClass(). It should only be used by ClassFile.getInstanceOfClass(). It will not accept an offset but expect the bytes array to contain the ful data of the class and nothing else.

Parameters:
name - The name of the class.
b - The bytes of the class.
Returns:
An instance of Class.

This method is used for the retrieval of any class.

Returns:
The loaded but not yet initialized ClassFile.
Throws:
ClassFileException - On fatal errors loading or parsing a class file.

getClassAsClassFile

                              throws ClassFileException
This method is used for the retrieval of any class.

Returns:
The loaded but not yet initialized ClassFile.
Throws:
ClassFileException - On fatal errors loading or parsing a class file.

getClassAsClassFile

public ClassFile getClassAsClassFile(java.lang.String name,
                                     boolean refresh)
                              throws ClassFileException
This method is used for the retrieval of any class. It has an additional parameter, refresh, which can be set to true to ensure a class will not be reloaded from the cache but read and parsed. If it already existed in the cache, the old copy will be overwritten.

Parameters:
name - The full name of the desired class, including the package (e.g. java.lang.String).
refresh - If set to true, the class file will be read and parsed even if it is cached.
Returns:
The loaded but not yet initialized ClassFile.
Throws:
ClassFileException - Thrown on fatal errors loading or parsing a class file.

isClassLoaded

public boolean isClassLoaded(java.lang.String name)
Check if a class has already been loaded by this class loader.

Parameters:
name - The full name of the desired class, including the package (e.g. java.lang.String).
Returns:
true, if the class is already loaded (and cached); false otherwise.

updateClassPath

public void updateClassPath(java.lang.String[] classPathEntries,
                            boolean discardLoadedClassesIfUnequal)
Method to update the class path.

Parameters:
classPathEntries - The new String array of class path entries.
discardLoadedClassesIfUnequal - If set to true, any cached entries will be discarded if the class path was not just appended.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If classPathEntries is null or empty.

resetInitializedClassFileCache

public void resetInitializedClassFileCache()
Clear the cache of initialized classes.

undoOptimizations

public void undoOptimizations()
Undo any optimizations done at the level of class file structured, especially by replacing byte code with optimized code. This operation is working in an own thread, yet it is blocking the class cache. For a large number of classes loaded, it might take a while to complete.

unloadAllInstructions

public void unloadAllInstructions()
Unload any cached instructions from methods of class files. This should be done any time byte code level optimization settings are changed. This operation is working in an own thread, yet it is blocking the class cache. For a large number of classes loaded, it might take a while to complete.

getNextLoadingNumber

public long getNextLoadingNumber()
Get the next loading number and increase it by one. This method is only to be used by initializing ClassFiles that want to receive their loading number.

Returns:
The next loading number.

getNextInstantiationNumber

public long getNextInstantiationNumber()
Get the next instantiation number and increase it by one. This method is only to be used by initializing ReferenceValues that want to receive their instantiation number. Each reference value that is supposed to be used within the virtual machine has to get an instantiation number. It is an unique identifier for it.

Returns:
The next instantiation number.

resetInstantiationNumber

public void resetInstantiationNumber()
Reset the number of instantiated classes to zero. This should only be done when starting execution in a new virtual machine. Otherwise, two distinct objects might have the same instantiation number and thus the same hash code.

getClassesLoaded

public long getClassesLoaded()
Getter for the number of classes loaded.

Returns:
The number of classes loaded.

getClassesInstantiated

public long getClassesInstantiated()
Getter for the number of classes instantiated.

Returns:
The number of classes instantiated.

insertManuallyLoadedClassfile

public void insertManuallyLoadedClassfile(ClassFile classFile)
Insert a manually loaded class file into this class loaders cache of loaded class files. This method is meant to be used if for any reasons a ClassFile is instantiated directly. However, class files can only be inserted if their class loader has been specified as this.

Parameters:
classFile - The ClassFile to be inserted.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the class loader of the class file is inappropriate or if it already in the classes' cache.
java.lang.NullPointerException - If classFile is null.
